*
  • If the list is empty, shows an empty list message.

*

* Command to mark a {@link Task} in the task list as done
/** Associated command keyword and status code. */
public static final Command COMMAND = Command.MARK;
/** Index of the task to be marked as done. */
* @param index Index of the task to be marked done
* Marks the specified task in the task list as done.

*
  • If the index is invalid, an {@link InvalidIndexException} is thrown.

*
  • If the task is already marked, an informational message is shown.

*
  • If the task is successfully marked, a confirmation message is shown.
* @throws InvalidIndexException If the provided index is out of range

*

*

*
  • If the task is successfully unmarked, a confirmation message is shown.

* Exception thrown when the user enters an unrecognised command keyword.
* For example, typing {@code todone} instead of {@code todo}.
* The exception stores the invalid command string and attempts
* to suggest a similar valid command in its error message.
/** Invalid command keyword entered by the user. */
* Creates an InvalidCommandException with the given invalid keyword and message.
* Attempts to find a similar valid command to suggest to the user.
* Current implementation is primitive: it compares the first letter
* of the invalid keyword with the first letters of all known commands.
* @return A suggestion string if a similar command is found,
* Returns the formatted error message including the invalid keyword
* and, if applicable, a suggested valid command.
* @return Detailed error message with the invalid command and suggestion.

* Handles persistent storage of tasks for the Moon chatbot.
* The {@code Storage} class is responsible for:

*
  • Ensuring the storage file and parent directories exist.

*
  • Loading tasks from the storage file into a {@link TaskList}.

*
  • Rewriting the storage file with the current tasks.
* Creates a {@code Storage} instance for the specified file path.
* Ensures the storage file exists, creating directories and the file if necessary.
* @param filepath Path to the storage file
* @throws IOException If the file or directories cannot be created
* Ensures the storage file and its parent directories exist.
* If the parent directory does not exist, it is created. If the storage
* file does not exist, an empty file is created.
* @throws IOException If the file or directories cannot be created
// If the file doesn’t exist, create an empty one
* Loads all tasks from the storage file into a {@link TaskList}.
* Each non-blank line is parsed into a {@link Task} using
* @return A {@code TaskList} containing tasks from storage
* @throws IOException     If the storage file cannot be read
* @throws ParseException  If any line cannot be parsed into a valid task
public TaskList load() throws IOException, ParseException {
* Rewrites the storage file with the given list of tasks.
* Existing content is truncated before writing. Each task is
* converted into its storage string using {@link Task#toStorageString()}.
* @param tasks The task list to save
* @throws IOException If the file cannot be written to
public void rewrite(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
